DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

Capacity: NA

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster Parent Information
Section (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with all of the following
Descr information before the placement or replacement of a child:
Christ Child (f) All known behaviors of the child.
Detroit - Child
1

Placing
Institution (CPA)
ption
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Foster parent did not receive information about child’s behaviors
prior to placement.
Investigation The Chief Administrator was interviewed via video on March
1, 2023. The Chief Administrator reported that Foster Child A was
placed with the Complainant from January 24, 2022, to February
1, 2022, and again from February 16, 2022, to October 31, 2022.
The Chief Administrator reported that the case worker will typically
inform the foster parent of issues and concerns about a child to be
placed in the home. The Chief Administrator also reported that
when a child moves from one foster home to another the agency
will provide the foster homes of their respective phone numbers so
they can share information about the child before placement. The
Chief Administrator reported that Staff 1, who is the worker for
Foster Child A, left the agency on March 4, 2022, and retained a
position with Marquette/Alger/Schoolcraft DHHS. At that time
Foster Child A’s case was transferred to that county office. The
Chief Administrator reported that Staff 1 was a very good and
capable worker and that she could provide me with details of the
case. The Chief Administrator added that the Complainant never
contacted the agency with concerns about not being provided
relevant information about Foster Child A upon placement.
The agency Program Supervisor was also interviewed during
the video interview with the Chief Administrator on March 1,
2023.
The Program Supervisor reaffirmed that the agency had never
received concerns from the Complainant regarding a lack of
information about Foster Child A’s behavioral issues upon
placement. The Program Supervisor reported that it is agency
practice to connect foster parents with one another to share
information when a child is to be replaced. The Program
Supervisor reported that Staff 1 is a good worker and she would
be able to provide more detail about the placement of Foster Child
A into the home of the Complainant.
Staff 1, the former agency case worker and now the current
DHHS Worker was interviewed via phone on March 7, 2023.
Staff 1 reported that when Foster Child A was placed in the home
of the Complainant there was little information to provide her with
regarding behavioral concerns. The previous foster home had not
2

reported behavioral concerns and was preparing to adopt Foster
Child A. Foster Child A was removed from this home when there
were safety concerns involving a MIC investigation.
Staff 1 reported that when Foster Child A was placed with the
Complainant there were some “ups and downs” but nothing
serious. Staff 1 reported that when Foster Child A was placed a
second time at the home of the Complainant she informed the
Complainant that Foster Child A will take cell phones and get onto
social media.
Staff 1 reported that she provided Foster Parent 1 and the
Complainant with cell phone numbers so they could share
information about Foster Child A when the child was placed a
second time with the Complainant. Foster Child A was placed with
Foster Parent 1 from February 1, 2022, to February 16, 2022. This
placement was an interim placement between the two placements
with the Complainant. Staff 1 reported that she did not have a
written record of providing Foster Parent 1 and Foster Parent 2
with their phone numbers.
On March 7, 2023, Foster Parent 1, was called and a voice
mail message left asking for a return call.
Foster Parent 1 was interviewed via phone on March 23, 2023.
Foster Parent 1 reported that Staff 1 had provided her the phone
number of the Complainant and that she and the Complainant had
a phone conversation about Foster Child A. Foster Parent 1
informed the Complainant that she had concerns about Foster
Child A and that she felt the child needed residential treatment.
Foster Parent 1 further reported that she had transported Foster
Child A to the placement at the Complainants home and had at
that time provided the Complainant with additional information
about Foster Child A’s behaviors. Foster Parent 1 reported that
she informed the Complainant that Foster Child A had flirting
behaviors and that she needed “healing tools”.
3

The Complainant was interviewed via phone on March 23,
2023.
The Complainant reported that she did not receive any information
about Foster Child A prior to or upon placement. The Complainant
reported that in a phone call from UP Kids she was told that
Foster Child A had some behavioral issues but was not given
specifics. The Complainant further reported that Staff 1 had told
her that Foster Child A “really doesn’t have any behavioral
issues”. The Complainant reported that when Foster Child A was
placed with them that she would steal and that she had engaged
in cutting behaviors. The Complainant was asked if she had
received the phone number of Foster Parent 1 from Staff 1 so they
could share information. The Complainant denied that she was
given Foster Parent 1’s phone number. The Complainant denied
that she and Foster Parent 1 had talked about Foster Child A prior
to her placement in her home.
The Complainant was asked why she was filing a complaint at this
time since time had elapsed since the initial placement in January
2022. The Complainant stated, “I was trying to take the higher
road” and not file a complaint but decided to file the complaint
when there were recent allegations against my son that he had
inappropriately touched Foster Child A when she was placed in
the home.
Analysis The Chief Administrator and Program Supervisor reported that the
agency case worker will inform the foster parent of a child’s
behaviors prior to placement and that is agency practice to
connect foster parents with each other’s phone numbers to share
information. The Chief Administrator and Program Supervisor
reported that the Complainant had never contacted the agency
with a concern that she had not received information about the
behaviors of Foster Child A at the time of placement.
Staff 1 reported that there was limited information at the time of
placement. Staff 1 reported that she had provided Foster Parent 1
and the Complainant of their respective phone numbers at or
around the time of the second placement at the Complainants
home. Staff 1 also reported she informed the Complainant that
Foster Child A will take cell phones and use social media. Staff 1
reported that the Complainant had never contacted her with
concerns that she had not received information about Foster Child
A’s behaviors at or prior to placement.
4

Foster Parent 1 reported that she received the phone number of
the Complainant from Staff 1 and that she and the Complainant
had talked on the phone about Foster Child A’s behaviors.
The Complainant denied that she had received information from
Staff 1 or the agency about Foster Child A prior to or at
placement. The Complainant denied that Staff 1 had provided her
with the phone number of Foster Parent 1 or that they had a
phone conversation about Foster Child A.
Evidence is conflicted regarding whether the Complainant
received behavioral information about Foster Child A prior to or at
placement.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROVIDED: The agency lacked
documentation which described efforts of the agency to
inform a prospective foster parent of known behaviors of a
foster child. If an agency worker informs a prospective foster
parent of a child’s behaviors this should be documented in
the social work contacts. Any efforts such as the agency’s
reported practice of connecting foster parents with phone
numbers should also be documented. If behaviors are
unknown documentation that the foster parent was informed
as such should be documented.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
The recommendation is for continuance of the regular license.
_ April 25, 2023

Douglas W Turrill Date
